abstract: Alabama's far-reaching immigration law contains a schools provision that requires primary and secondary schools to record the immigration status of incoming students and their parents; critics of the law say that the provision is discriminatory and is scaring immigrants away from schools.
snippet: The schools provision of the immigration law is a first step in a larger strategy to topple a 29-year-old Supreme Court ruling that all children in the United States are guaranteed an education.
lead_paragraph: The schools provision of the immigration law is a first step in a larger strategy to topple a 29-year-old Supreme Court ruling that all children in the United States are guaranteed an education.
